moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: 6...e5!?  seems to give white good attacking chances through routine moves.
moves.7. Bxf6: Trying to exploit d5 and backward pawn
moves.9... Qa5+ 10. c3: Blocks check and threatens to drive queen back
moves.10... Kd7: A concession that Black has erred; now the king is trapped in the center.
moves.11... Qa6 12. Nbc7 Qa3: The only place for the queen.
moves.13... Ne7 14. Nac7 Nxd5 15. Nxd5: White's commanding knight on d5 continues to plague Black
moves.17. O-O: White expected Kd8, and moving too fast, overlooks 17 Qg4  followed by mate.
